revised_title: Correlating Germicidal Action with Selective Absorption in Ultra-Violet Radiation
tldr: The authors investigate the germicidal action of ultra-violet radiation and its correlation with selective absorption. They find that the most effective germicidal portion of the ultra-violet spectrum is between 2940 to 2380 Angstrom units, and that this region corresponds almost exactly with the portion of the spectrum absorbed by the bacterial emulsion.
